SENT.plain: Granulocytic sarcomas (GS) are extramedullary tumour masses of immature myeloid cells, also known as chloroma and extramedullary myeloid cell tumour
These neoplasms usually occur simultaneously with, or follow the onset of acute myeloid leukaemia (AML)
Rarely, they are the first manifestation of AML
GS may also be the first sign of transformation to AML in patients with chronic myeloproliferative disorders and myelodysplastic syndromes
GS have been reported to occur in a variety of tissues, but presentation as an abdominal mass and, in particular, infiltration of the pancreas is rare
We report two cases of pancreatic GS, review the literature, and discuss recent insights into the basic biological properties of these rare tumours
